snippet: With the war on terror seemingly a forever war, demands for openness clash with the advantages of secrecy, as shown in the debate over the National Security Agency.
abstract: News Analysis; House vote to end and replace National Security Agency's bulk collection of phone records is striking because open debate about cost of national security has been rare in 14 years since Sept 11 attacks; highlights question of where to draw line between advantages of secrecy and demands for openness in shadow of war on terror that shows no sign of abating.
lead_paragraph: With the war on terror seemingly a forever war, demands for openness clash with the advantages of secrecy, as shown in the debate over the National Security Agency.

headline.print_headline: A Debate Over How Long Democracy Can Wage Battles in Shadows
